page.title: 02The George Inn:the Deverills
page.content: { The George}stands at the crossroads in{Longbridge Deverill}village. It is a very attractive building,white washed stone with a pantile roof. It has a lovely inn sign showing King George the Third. Many years ago it was a farm believed to be mentioned in the{Domesday {Book.}There is documentary evidence from the 12th century that{Thomas a {Becket}stayed at the Inn when he visited Longbridge Deverill to consecrate the church. Today it is a very busy Inn, serving many motorists on their way along the A35O to the beach. The innkeepers came to the Inn in 198O. They did not make any alterations, they liked the atmosphere of the small cosy bars. Seven people work here in the busy summer season and many village activities centre on the Inn.
